title: Urgot is getting tatted in his new splash

replies.body:
Don't want to be nitpicky here, but isn't that actually branding?
At least it doesn't look like he is getting a tattoo. More like they are burning something on his skin with chemicals, maybe acid? Is there a special name for the process if you do it with acid?

Sounds good for me.
With that one guy working on his knee and the other scarificating him, it does look like Urgot is already pretty successful with his own organisation to destroy the chembarons.

Any information how big of a deal it is in Zaun? Is Camille aware of it? And if so, how does she feel about it?
What are they tattoos of though? The one he's currently getting looks like the Zaun faction symbol.
The insignias of fallen chem-barons last I checked. A nice visual reminder to anyone who looks upon Urgot that he's scarier than he looks.
So the dude in the very back with that same insignia is a chem baron then? I keep finding more and more reasons to love the new Urgot.
Why is he keeping that guy in a tube anyways?
How many chem-barons are there? Do new ones take over the fallen ones?

I don't know an exact number, but I know of a few: Saito Takeda, Artega Holt, Petrok Grime, Marko Volkage, Velveteen Lenore, Wencher Spindlow and one fellow who I only know as Baron Crimson.

Yeah new ones pop up when old ones kick the bucket or are otherwise disposed. Some get betrayed, some might die in accidents, some end up like Marko and get killed by a champion. It all varies.

> [{quoted}](name=Sharjo,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=K9601Eqn,comment-id=0000000000020000,timestamp=2017-07-08T23:41:17.848+0000)
>
> I don't know an exact number, but I know of a few: Saito Takeda, Artega Holt, Petrok Grime, Marko Volkage, Velveteen Lenore, Wencher Spindlow and one fellow who I only know as Baron Crimson.
> 
> Yeah new ones pop up when old ones kick the bucket or are otherwise disposed. Some get betrayed, some might die in accidents, some end up like Marko and get killed by a champion. It all varies.

Will we ever see more of Saito Takeda? He's a very interesting character who plays a part in Zac and Evelynn''s lore. Plus we don't have any champions that is/likes Chem barons
The chem-barons are a large part of Zaun, so them popping up in future stories is almost guaranteed, especially for Takeda, whose so involved in the backstory of a champion.

> A nice visual reminder to anyone who looks upon Urgot that he's scarier than he looks.

> scarier than he looks.

 
What... that shouldn't be humanly possible!!
